Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body and neck section of a brown pottery vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394913) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394913)
